resources.string: SQRL Login - Rask, sikker og pålitelig innlogging

Secure Quick Reliable Login

Velkommen til disse hjelpesidene. Her vil vi forsøke å forklare de forskjellige konseptene i protokollen. Vi vil også forsøke å vise de forskjellige måtene du kan bruke applikasjonen på. 

Du kan vise de forskjellige hjelpesidene ved å sveipe til venstre eller høyre. 

Hvis du er interessert i å se på koden til denne applikasjonen finner du den på https://github.com/kalaspuffar/secure-quick-reliable-login under en åpen kildekode-lisens.

Kort fortalt

Før du kan begynne å bruke SQRL til å logge inn på websider som støtter dette, må du opprette din private SQRL-identitet. Du trenger bare en, sannsynligvis for resten av livet. Denne avslører ingenting om deg, og er svært sikker. Det er bare et svært langt (77-siffer) tilfeldig tall. 

Når du har opprettet din private identitet, vil SQRL bruke denne til å generere et annet 77-siffer langt tall som bare gjelder siden du prøver å logge inn på. Hver side du prøver å logge inn på ser deg som et forskjellig nummer. Dette nummeret er forskjellig hver gang du besøker siden.

Dette lar deg være permanent og unikt identifisert, men samtidig helt anonym. 

Siden du ikke trenger å identifisere deg med en epostadresse eller et passord, vil du aldri gi fra deg noe som er knyttet til din identitet. Hvis websidens liste over sqrl-identiteter noensinne blir eksponert eller stjålet, vil skaden være svært begrenset siden disse identitetene vil være spesifikke for denne websiden, og SQRLs kryptografiske funksjoner forhindrer identitetsutvikling ved hjelp av stjålne identiteter.

Ditt SQRL passord

SQRL logger deg inn på websider for deg, uten at du må oppgi brukernavn eller passord. Men det betyr også at hvis noen får kontroll på din mobil eller PC vil de kunne logge seg inn som om de var deg. 

Vi løser dette problemet ved å beskytte SQRL-appen med et passord, sin DU må oppgi i når du starter SQRL. Du bestemmer selv hvor mye beskyttelse du trenger. Du velger ditt passord selv, med den lengde og kompleksitet du sov ønsker. For å gjøre livet til hackere vanskeligere, kan du velge hvor lenge passordet skal prosesseres. Og for å gjøre bruken av lange og komplekse passord enklere, kan du bruke de fire første tegnene i passordet til å "friske opp" et fullt passord man nylig har tastet inn.

Du kan selv endre passord i klienten når og så ofte du selv ønsker. Og skulle du glemme passordet ditt, har SQRL redningskoder.

SQRLs redningskoder

Du og SQRL vil sannsynligvis aldri behøve å bli reddet. Men SQRLs sikkerhet er så tett at du kanskje vil trenge en måte å løsne litt på sikkerhetstiltakene. Her er et par scenarier hvor du vil trenge å bruke redningskodene: 

• Hvis du endret på passordet ditt og du ikke greier å huske det nye passordet ditt, finnes det ingen du kan spørre. I motsetning til nettsteder, som ofte har 'glemt passord?' funksjonalitet, kjenner ikke SQRL til passordet ditt. Hvis den gjorde det, kunne den blitt hacket og bli brukt til å stjele identiteten din. Backups du har tatt vil være lagret med det passordet du hadde da, så det kan være til hjelp. Men SQRLs redningskoder vil alltid hjelpe deg ut av knipen. 

• Når du har etablert din identitet på et nettsted, kan den identiteten bli endret med hjelp av dennes redningskode. Hvis noen skulle lykkes med å stjele identiteten din (f.eks hvis telefonen din blir stjålet og tyven greier å gjette ditt veldig svake passord, eller vha malware), vil de aldri kunne bytte ut din identitet med sin egen. Men du kan reetablere din egen identitet ved å lage en ny identitet og bytte ut den gamle med din nye ved å bruke en redningskode.

SQRLs redningskoder er en kraftig alliert. Skriv den ned, oppbevar den på et sikkert sted, og mist ikke kontrollen over den. Du kommer sannsynligvis aldri til å trenge den, men hvis du gjør dey, vil du være glad du tok vare på den.

Hvorfor backup?

SQRL sin private identitet er er tilfeldig valgt, 77-siffer langt nummer som brukes til å generere hver og en av dine nettstedsidentiteter. Ingen kjenner din private identitet. Når du bruker SQRL til å identifisere deg rundt omkring på nettet, blir det 77-sifrede nummeret din identitet. Hvis det går tapt, vil du ikke lenger kunne logge deg inn på de nettstedene hvor denne identiteten har blitt benyttet. 

En annen grunn til å ta backups er for å kopiere den inn på en annen datamaskin eller telefon. Når din private identitet har blitt installert på alle dine enheter, kan du bruke dem til å identifisere deg på nettet. 

SQRL tilbyr mange enkle måter å ta backup av din private identitet på, og alle backups er alltid beskyttet av ditt personlige passord, og din redningskode. 

Det anbefales å skrive ut en backup, i form av en QR-kode og litt tekst på et ark papir. Papir er det orginale lagringsformatet, og på mange måter fortsatt det beste. Det kan enkelt lagres sammen med de andre viktige dokumentene man har i sitt arkiv, som fødselsattester, vitnemål og attester. Backups kan også lagres digitalt på en minnepinne eller en CD-ROM. Ingen kjenner din identitet, så ta backup!

Velkommen til SQRL klienten

Denne appen vil lagre din private identitet sikkert på denne enheten. Du kan bruke denne for å autentisere deg mot et nettsted. 

Dataene denne klienten lagrer, inneholder ingen personlige data, den bare verifisrer at den samme enheten som ble benyttet til autentisering forrige gang, er den samme som benyttes nå. Dette gjør det mulig å opprette unike og anonyme logins på dine favorittnettsteder, og du kan velge hvor mye informasjon du ønsker å dele med nettstedet. 

Denne applikasjonen vil ikke skjule informsasjon som telefonen eksponerer, men den vil heller ikke eksponere ytterligere informasjon. 

Du starter prosessen med å laste ned desktop-klienten fra https://grc.com og opprette en identitet med denne. Bruk så appen til å scanne QR-koden desktop-appen genererer og åpne den med ditt passord. Når nøkkelen er åpen i appen, kan du bruke den til å scanne QR-koder fra nettsteder som støtter SQRL. Verfiser at nettadressen er korrekt, og velg å logge inn. 

Noter at for å kunne scanne QR-koder, trenger appen tilgangsrettigheter til å kunne bruke kameraet. 

Ønsker du å følge utviklingen av denne appen kan du gjøre dette på https://github.com/kalaspuffar/secure-quick-reliable-login

Secure Quick Reliable Login

Versjon: %s

Github repository:
https://github.com/kalaspuffar/secure-quick-reliable-login

Laget av: Daniel Persson
Du har lykkes å scanne din private identitet. Vennligst verifiser at redningskodene som vises nedenfor korresponderer med dataene på nøkkel-siden.
Ugyldig svar, serveren svarte ikke med en feilkode. Prøv igjen senere.
Bad ID Association: SQRL identity which may be associated with the query nut does not match the SQRL ID used to submit the query.
Serveren skjønte ikke hva appen spurte om, så forespørselen ble ignorert
Command failed: The web server has encountered a problem successfully processing the query.
Function(s) not supported: Requested one or more SQRL functions, that the server does not currently support.
SQRL authentication for this identity has previously been disabled. To use this identity it needs to be enabled using rescue code.
Transient error: The server indicates that the signature(s) are correct, but something about the query prevented the command from completing.
To be secure, QuickPass should be removed after use.\nClick here to clear it from memory.
QuickPass is still in memory, unable to be removed
Decrypting identity failed, please try with another password.
Encryption of your newly imported identity failed, please try again
Your identity is unlocked in your device memory.
Using this protocol you may log in to the scanned URL. Please check that the scanned domain is the same as the place you want to visit before entering password.
Do you want to login to:
Retyped password doesn\'t match new password.
QuickPass input is not a number
QuickPass timeout input is not a number
Password verify input is not a number

In order to set a new password without knowing the old one you need to supply the rescue code given to you at identity creation. Then you supply a new password and we will create a password secured identity.
Rescue code part need to be 4 numbers

Creating a new identity is a process done in 6 steps.

1. First, the camera will be activated and you wave it around to create entropy to make a more secure key.

2. Next up you will be presented with a rescue code that you need to record and keep safe.

3. You will be asked to reenter the rescue code in order to verify that it's been recorded correctly.

4. You'll select a password for your new identity.

5. The application creates and encrypts your identity.

6. You'll be presented with the option to save your identity for store keeping in a safe place.

Rekeying your identity is a process done in 7 steps.

1. First, you need to enter the old rescue code for this identity in order to verify that you have access to this security code.

2. Second, the camera will be activated and you wave it around to create entropy to make a more secure key.

3. Next up you will be presented with a new rescue code that you need to record and keep safe.

4. You will be asked to reenter the rescue code in order to verify that it's been recorded correctly.

5. You'll select a password for your new identity.

6. The application creates and encrypts your identity.

7. You'll be presented with the option to save your identity for store keeping in a safe place.

This page shows your identity rescue code. This code is important that you record somewhere safe. If you need in the future to restore, unlock or remove your accounts this code will be used to verify that you are the correct owner of this identity. Store it safe and off this device. The code is presented left to right starting in the upper left and ending in the lower right. You may add dashes or minuses in your recording to easily distinguish between the groups of 4 characters.
On this page, we ask you to enter the rescue code that you recorded and saved in a secure place in order to show that you have recorded the correct value.
Failure! The call to the program had no link attached, please try again.
Unable to create temporary directory for file to send, do you have too much data on disk?
Enter rescue code to verify that you have this secure in your possession, and start the process of rekeying the identity.

The identity has been successfully created/rekeyed. In order to use this safely and be able to restore from loss of device we recommend that you export your identity either by scanning QRCode with another device, sending a file to storage or printing the new identity.

In order to create and import identities and also to log in, the app needs to use the camera.

When creating an identity, the app uses the camera to gather random data to improve the security of that identity.

In the case of import and log in, the app gives you the option to scan QR codes in order to input data required for that task.
The printing function was not implemented before Android KitKat (4.4)

This printed identity was encrypted with the password it had at the time, and also with its permanent Rescue Code. Since either the correct Password, or the identity\'s Rescue Code, will allow this identity to be used by anyone, neither of those should be stored with, or in any way available with, this printed identity:

As an additional recovery measure, a textual version of this identity is provided below. If a camera is not available to scan and import the QR code above, the text below may be entered for full identity recovery. However, this is a Rescue Code ONLY version, so this identity\'s Rescue Code will be required for its decryption:

Please retain and protect this printed version of your identity. With SQRL\'s \"two-party\" operation, no one can compromise your SQRL login security. But this also means that there is no one to turn to if your identity is somehow lost or misplaced. Please treat this identity with the care it deserves. It is your secure and private key to the Internet.
Page created by Android open-source SQRL client on the
Denne identiteten har fått ny nøkkel så mange ganger at vi må fjerne den eldste nøkkelen. Nettsteder som benytter denne nøkkelen vil ikke lenger vi kjenne gjen din identitet.
Å lage kontoer krever mer sikkerhet, vennligst prøv igjen med hele passordet.

Below you can enter the text supplied with your identity to import it. After that\'s done your prompted to enter rescue code and a new password. Each row of the identity text will be verified separately.
The text entered does not validate to a correct identity string. Checksum error. Please check if the text entered might contain errors.
Input identity rescue text printed on your identity paper version
Unable to connect to server, please try again
Are you sure you want to remove this identity?

You should CANCEL, or proceed with caution!

SQRL identity spoof protection has been prevented from operating. This could be the result of a system or web browser configuration setting. But since SQRL anti-spoof system is usually functional, this failure could be the result of an intentional attempt to steal your online identity for the website shown below, by a malicious website that is spoofing its identity.

You MAY proceed to use SQRL, but you should be VERY SURE that you wish to provide your personal SQRL identity for the website show below to the website you are logging into -- THEY MAY NOT BE THE SAME.

Possible Login Attack Detected

Login prevented

The website you were attempting to login to with SQRL may have been "spoofing" the actual website's identity in an attempt to capture your SQRL identity and use it to login to the real website as you.
You changed orientation or moved around in the application during operation. The current operation might not be completed correctly, please try again.
The SQRL login page has expired. Please refresh the page, then log in with SQRL.
SQRL was unable to login to this site. Please refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists please use another login method.
Indicates whether the password contains lowercase letters
Indicates whether the password contains uppercase letters
Indicates whether the password contains digits
Indicates whether the password contains symbols
You are using a very short password. This is highly insecure and should absolutely be avoided!
This file does not appear to be a valid SQRL identity file.
Please install a file manager app from the Google Play Store.
Quickpass was not and is not active
QuickPass was already active, and still is
Type your SQRL password here to enable QuickPass for `%1$s`.
Scan Web QR Code for Login
Enter SQRL password to engage QuickPass
An identity must be created before using this function
So you don\'t forget your SQRL master password, the maximum QuickPass timeout is one week ( %1$s minutes), after which you\'ll have to type in the master password again.

Since the identity being imported has no password set, it is required for you to provide the rescue code given to you at identity creation. You will then chose a new password, which your newly imported identity will be secured with.

Your identity\'s security can be improved by lengthening the time required to verify your full SQRL password. There is NO KNOWN WAY for any attacker, spy agency or government to dramatically speed up this verification process. And since your shorter QuickPass can be used after you have entered your password, you only need to wait once. But someone trying to guess your password needs to wait EVERY TIME they guess.\n\nA five-second verification duration is recommended, but you are free to choose whatever seems best for your convenience and security.

To encourage the use of a longer and more secure access password, SQRL can be configured to only require that your FULL password be provided when it is first used and periodically after that. Once the full password has been entered, for a specified period of time, SQRL may only require the first few characters of your password (called a "QuickPass") just to prove it is still you. (How long the "QuickPass" is active for is called the "QuickPass timeout" and can also be set in the identity settings). 

You chose between a longer and safer QuickPass or a shorter and more convenient one. What makes this trade-off acceptable is that the QuickPass MUST be entered correctly on the first try or the full password will be required again. 

Four characters are the recommended length. But you may set it as low as 1 and as long as your full password.

For protection, SQRL\'s QuickPass will be erased after some time. This time span is specified by the QuickPass timeout.\n\nAfter the timeout, SQRL will ask for the FULL password again on the next login.
Request SQRL-enabled websites to disable all other non-SQRL login methods for maximum security.
Request SQRL-enabled websites to refuse any and all forms of \"I forgot my password\" account recovery.
No account found on the server

It is usually sufficient and desirable for SQRL to present only one user identity for each website. For this normal operation, alternate identities are not used and the alternate identity name field must remain blank.

But there may be times when a single SQRL user wishes to present alternate identities to a single website. Such use might be a quick one-time event to appear anonymously as an identity the website has never encountered before and may never encounter again, or a user may choose to make permanent longer-term use of alternate identities.

Although these quick alternate identities can be used to create persistent identities, an alternative is to create one or more additional standard SQRL identities. While that approach can be more cumbersome, for some users and uses it may be more appropriate.

Any characters entered into the alternate identity name field will cause a unique and unlinkable alternate identity to be presented to a website. It will be impossible for the website to connect this alternate identity to the normal identity.

It is appropriate to regard these characters as the alternate identity's name because every time the same characters are used the same alternate identity will be presented. Any characters may be used, but since they must be remembered if the same alternate identity will be needed in the future, a meaningful and memorable name should be chosen.

The alternate identity names are case sensitive, so they must be reused exactly. Any that will be reused may be written down and permanently recorded to eliminate any confusion in the future.

Also, note that the alternate identity name is not remembered by SQRL and it is not persistent. It will be cleared after use and must be supplied every time the normal identity is to be overridden.

Despite the use of every possible protection, it is still conceivable that some entity, whether criminal or civil, might somehow obtain access to your SQRL identity. To protect against unauthorized use, any website may be instructed to disable its recognition of your SQRL identity. In this way, SQRL access can be blocked for your most important accounts. In doing this you will be blocking your own access with SQRL, but also the access by anyone who may have somehow obtained your SQRL identity. In other words, you cannot use SQRL to access disabled accounts, but neither can anyone else.

Only an SQRL client that has been loaded with the identity's secret Rescue Code can re-enable SQRL access or replace a compromised SQRL identity with another. And an identity's secret Rescue Code can never be stolen or inadvertently disclosed because it is never carried inside the SQRL software and it is never saved onto any storage device.

Since re-enabling a website's disabled identity requires the identity's Rescue Code, you should be certain that you have access to the Rescue Code before disabling your own access.

If you have previously disabled your SQRL account for a specific site, you can re-enable it using this function.\n\nPlease note, that this operation will require the use of the identity\'s secret Rescue Code that was given to you upon identity creation.

There are several reasons why you might wish to completely remove your SQRL identity from a website:

You might wish to stop using SQRL to authenticate your identity to a particular website. If so, though it is not required, you might wish to permanently remove your SQRL identity.

Or you might be sharing a single SQRL identity with others, but wish to remove one or more websites from access by other users of that SQRL identity.

Or you might wish to hand over SQRL identity authentication for a website to a different SQRL identity. Unless a website supports multiple simultaneous SQRL identities, you would need to first remove your identity so that the replacement identity can then be added.

To ease the identity transfer process, the removal of your SQRL identity will leave your current web browser session logged into your website account so that another SQRL identity can be immediately added. This might be important if the site only offers SQRL authentication.

To prevent the possibility of malicious identity replacement, identity removal requires the extra security provided by the identity's Rescue Code. If the identity's Rescue Code is not already loaded into the SQRL client you will be prompted to provide it before proceeding with the authentication and identity removal.

SQRL\'s CPS authentication has been aborted. You will be automatically sent back to the previous page in a few seconds. If this does not work, please press your browser\'s \"BACK\" button or click on the link below.
Please provide the short \"QuickPass\", which consists of the first few characters of your SQRL identity password.
Please provide the full-length SQRL identity password that you have chosen for this identity.
This is your Identity\'s Rescue Code

This is the irreplaceable SQRL Rescue Code for the SQRL identity you are creating.

This code cannot be recreated and must not be lost, misplaced or destroyed. It will allow you to recover from any disaster that might occur. If your identity's password is forgotten, or if your SQRL identity should become compromised, this Rescue Code allows you to recover from any situation. (Some situations may also require your SQRL identity. So be sure to also keep a backup of your identity.)

This printout should be stored in a safe and secure place where it cannot be found by others but CAN be retrieved if you should ever need it. That need may never arise. But if it does, you'll be glad that you kept it safe and secure.

Your identity's Rescue Code is:

This SQRL identity has been "rekeyed" and replaced and used by some other device to sign-in to this website. When that happened, this website learned of the replacement identity and switched to using it instead of the replaced identity.

After rekeying and replacing an identity, it MUST also be replaced on ALL of the other devices where it exists. That has not yet been done for your SQRL identity on this device, so it should be done immediately!

For your protection, your previous identity, which is still on this device, can no longer be used here. Please transfer your rekeyed identity from the device where it was rekeyed to the SQRL client on this device.

Thank you.
This field may not be empty
